summary.para:
In order to use aliases from this addin, you will need to also reference Newtonsoft.Json as an addin. Here is what including Cake.Json in your script should look like:
#addin package:?Cake.Json #addin package:?Newtonsoft.Json&version=11.0.2

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.DeserializeJsonFromFile``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Deserializes the JSON from a file.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.DeserializeJson``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes the JSON from a string.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.SerializeJsonToPrettyFile``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,``0)
member.summary: Serializes an object to a pretty JSON file.
member.typeparam: The type of object to serialize.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.SerializeJsonToFile``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,``0)
member.summary: Serializes an object to a JSON file.
member.typeparam: The type of object to serialize.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.SerializeJson``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,``0)
member.summary: Serializes an object to a JSON string.
member.typeparam: The type of object to serialize.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.SerializeJsonPretty``1(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,``0)
member.summary: Serializes an object to a pretty JSON string.
member.typeparam: The type of object to serialize.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.ParseJson(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the JSON into a JObject.

member.name: M:Cake.Json.JsonAliases.ParseJsonFromFile(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Parses the file contents into a JObject.

member.name: T:Cake.Json.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contain types representing data used for interaction with JSON.
